instruction: How was the adaptability of the hierarchical classification model tested in the study on classifying rice-cropping systems using a pretrained CNN?
Output: In the related study, the adaptability of the hierarchical classification model was tested by using a time series curve from another year with relatively insufficient data. The pretrained convolutional neural network (CNN) was trained and tested using multitemporal Sentinel-2 satellite images to obtain time series curves of texture (spatial trajectories) and the first derivative vegetation index (spectral trajectories). This testing demonstrated that the pretrained CNN model could effectively classify rice-cropping systems even with limited data, indicating its adaptability in different years and conditions.

instruction: Can the pretrained CNN method be considered superior to the SVM method in terms of accuracy for classifying rice-cropping systems?
Output: Yes, the pretrained CNN method can be considered superior to the SVM method in terms of accuracy for classifying rice-cropping systems.
